description: In this tutorial, we show how to calculate and visualize the electronic band gap using our Web Interface, for the simple case of crystalline silicon.
title: Exabyte.io Tutorial: Calculate Electronic Band Gap

youTubeCaptions.text: Create a simulation, by navigating to the job designer page.
Then, <break time='0.5' /> open the workflow tab, and choose the 'Band Gap' workflow by selecting it in the list.
After that, <break time='0.5' /> navigate to compute tab, and set compute configuration. Here, we use one node with four cores.
Then, <break time='0.5' /> set the name for the job. Here, we call it - Silicon Band Gap Calculation.
Next, <break time='0.5' /> save the job. <break time='1.0' /> It can then be selected and submitted to the compute queue, for execution.
The status of the calculation will, accordingly, change from submitted, to active.
When the job is finished, open it, to inspect the final results.

The band gap value can be found, at the bottom of the results page. Here, we can see the indirect gap, of about 0.6 eV, as expected from, the 'Generalized Gradient Approximation', in 'Density Functional Theory'.
